videopoker

Class Hand

    • videopoker.Hand

extends java.lang.Object

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCard(Card card)
      This method adds the Card object given by the parameter card to the Linked List hand

      This method adds the Card object given by the parameter card to the Linked List hand in a specific position index
      Hand copyHand()
      This method returns an object Hand hand with a copy of the original hand in order to able us to manipulate it without shuffling the order of the cards in the original hand

      This method verifies if the hand is empty or not

      This method returns the object Card card that is positioned on the index given by the parameter index of the linked list hand

      This method returns the index index in the original hand of the card given as argument

      This method iterates through the list getting the indexes in the original hand of the cards that will be advised to hold and puts them in the array res.

      This method removes an object Card from the Linked List hand that is in the position given by the parameter index

      This method sorts the linked list hand of the object Hand by rank.

      This method sorts the linked list hand of the object Hand by suit.

    • Field Detail

      • hand

        private java.util.LinkedList<Card> hand

    • Constructor Detail

      • Hand

        public Hand()
        Constructs an object of type Hand. Initializes a new empty object hand of type LinkedList of Cards

    • Method Detail

      • sortRank

        public void sortRank()
        This method sorts the linked list hand of the object Hand by rank. The lower rank gets the first position.

      • sortSuit

        public void sortSuit()
        This method sorts the linked list hand of the object Hand by suit. The suits don't show up in any specific order. Instead, they just show up grouped.

      • getCard

        public Card getCard(int index)
        This method returns the object Card card that is positioned on the index given by the parameter index of the linked list hand
        Parameters:
        index - index in the Linked List of the Card we wish to get
        Returns:
        card the card in the index given in parameter
        See Also:
        deckofcard.Card.java

      • copyHand

        public Hand copyHand()
        This method returns an object Hand hand with a copy of the original hand in order to able us to manipulate it without shuffling the order of the cards in the original hand
        Returns:
        hand copy of the original hand
        See Also:
        videopoker.Hand.java

      • getOriginalIndexes

        public int[] getOriginalIndexes(java.util.ArrayList<Card> holdList)
        This method iterates through the list getting the indexes in the original hand of the cards that will be advised to hold and puts them in the array res. After sorting this array, the method returns it.
        Parameters:
        holdList - list with cards that are advised to hold
        Returns:
        res array with the positions of those cards on the original hand, sorted

      • getIndex

        public int getIndex(Card card)
        This method returns the index index in the original hand of the card given as argument
        Parameters:
        card - Card object we wish to know the index
        Returns:
        index index of that card

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This method iterates through the hand and creates a visual description of the object Hand
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        handstring string with the visual description of the hand

      • addCard

        public void addCard(Card card)
        This method adds the Card object given by the parameter card to the Linked List hand
        Parameters:
        card - Card to be added to the hand

      • addCard

        public void addCard(int index,
                    Card card)
        This method adds the Card object given by the parameter card to the Linked List hand in a specific position index
        Parameters:
        index - index with the position to add the card
        card - Card to be added to the hand

      • removeCard

        public Card removeCard(int index)
        This method removes an object Card from the Linked List hand that is in the position given by the parameter index
        Parameters:
        index - position of the card we wish to extract from the hand
        See Also:
        deckofcard.Card.java

      • existsHand

        public boolean existsHand()
        This method verifies if the hand is empty or not
        Parameters:
        ver - boolean with the result of the verification
